title: [$250] Expense - Split status is removed after editing split, error after editing second split

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.94-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/77911 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdosdjnnosijsnoij@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open expense report. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Click More > Delete > Delete the report. 7. Go to self DM. 8. Open any split. 9. Click Report > Create report. 10. Click Amount. → Edit splits page opens. 11. Edit the amount and save it. 12. Click Amount field again. BUG 1: Split status is removed. Amount editor opens instead of Edit splits page. 13. Go to self DM. 14. Open the remaining split. 15. Click Report > Select the report in Step 9. 16. Click Amount. 17. Edit the amount and save it. BUG 2: "Unexpected error deleting this expense. Please try again later.The specified transaction is not one of the split transactions" error shows up. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Split status should persist after editing the split amount. Edit splits page should open after editing the split amount. BUG 2: No error should show up after editing the second split amount. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Split status is removed. Amount editor opens instead of Edit splits page. BUG 2: "Unexpected error deleting this expense. Please try again later.The specified transaction is not one of the split transactions" error shows up. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b396965a-10f0-46bf-a1f3-4f8c7b8a9be2 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Create a report 2. Create a billable expense 3. Create a reimbursable expense with a tax value 4. Create a non-reimbursable expense ## Expected Result: _This is a new feature/improvement that was seemingly missed along the way._ 1. Add "Tax:" subtotal, displayed if at least one expense on the report has a non-zero taxAmount value. 2. Add "Billable:" subtotal, displayed if at least one expense on the report is marked as billable. 3. Rename `Out-of-pocket spend:` to `Reimbursable:`. 4. Rename `Company spend:` to `Non-reimbursable:`. Classic for reference: ## Actual Result: - Tax and billable subtotals don't show in NewDot. - reimbursable / non-reimbursable naming is different on NewDot. title: [$150] Use `X` icon for closing the Concierge RHP instead of chevron

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C090U774ZH7/p1767385544707019?thread_ts=1767385544.707019&cid=C090U774ZH7 **What the problem is:** The Concierge right-hand panel (RHP) currently displays a left-facing chevron/back-arrow as the close control. The thread concluded this is unintuitive because the Concierge panel is an open/close panel (not a navigation hierarchy), so a back-arrow suggests navigation rather than a simple close action. **What the expected output is:** The Concierge RHP should present an 'X' close control on desktop to clearly indicate open/close behavior. Other RHPs that represent hierarchical navigation should retain the back-arrow/chevron. **Debugging info:** - Observed current state: other RHPs use a left-facing chevron; Concierge also uses a chevron. - Team consensus in thread: Concierge is not navigational and should use an 'X' instead of a chevron. - No PRs, logs, or additional technical artifacts were referenced in the discussion. **Solution:** - Replace the left-facing chevron/back-arrow with an 'X' icon for the Concierge RHP Created with the :create-gh-issue: automation Screenshot:
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.93-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2662/folder/13176922/41237509/1106546191 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat, 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 5. Tap on "Filters" 6. Tap on "Group By" > "From" and save the selection. 7. Tap on "View Results" 8. Expand the results displayed and open the just created expense. 9. Wait for the report to finish loading and return to "Expenses" 10. Note that a RBR is now visible on the "Inbox" tab. 11. Navigate to "Inbox" 12. Note that RBR is visible on preview of expense report. 13. Open the report. 14. Note that an "Unexpected error creating this chat" message is visible on report. 15. Dismiss the error message. 16. Navigate to workspace chat and return to "Inbox" again. 17. Note that RBR disappears after this last action. ## Expected Result: No error should be triggered when opening an expense from the results after applying the "Group By" filter. ## Actual Result: RBR and an "Unexpected error" message, appear when opening an expense after applying the "Group By" filter. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d294923-1c3d-46fb-a8f7-b3048d779e1c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Open the NewDot app 2. Navigate to the Workflow section 3. Toggle on the Auto-approve compliant report 4. Click the Upgrade button on the RHP 5. Toggle on the Auto-pay approve report 5. Go to the Overview and downgrade the Workspace to Collect 6. Navigate back to the Workflow section 7. Toggle off and on the Auto-approve compliant report (observe that it has required an upgrade RHP) ## Expected Result: The Auto-approve compliant report and Auto-pay approve report are toggle off, because when toggle off and toggle on again, it requires upgrading the Workspace to Control ## Actual Result: The Auto-approve compliant report and Auto-pay approve report are still on after downgrading the Workspace to Collect ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/735448d1-5ed2-4145-9124-1c8d4308e901 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.92-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2648/folder/13176744/41237150/1103830860 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsoidjnosijsiodjionjs@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Workspace default currency is not USD. - Distance rates and Taxes are enabled. - Workspace has at least two distance rates. - Track tax is enabled in Distance rates > Settings. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a distance expense. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Go offline. 6. Click Rate. 7. Change to other rate. 8. Click Amount. ## Expected Result: Currency will not change to USD after changing distance rate offline. ## Actual Result: Currency changes to USD after changing distance rate offline. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/753908d8-f357-4b81-83e9-dca85d9ee293 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Expense - Non-admin approver can indirectly edit unsubmitted split which leads to error

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.92-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2648/folder/13176791/41237175/1103830876 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+030101abc@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Create a workspace with admin, non-admin approver and member. Member: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Open any split. 7. Click Report field > Create report. 8. On the current report, which is the first report, click Submit. Non-admin approver: 7. Open member's first expense report (submitted report). 8. Click Amount field. 9. Edit the amount field of the second split which is not highlighted (which is the expense in unsubmitted report from Step 7). 10. Save it. ## Expected Result: Amount field on the unsubmitted split should be disabled because non-admin approver is not allowed to edit it. ## Actual Result: Amount field on the unsubmitted split is not disabled. Non-admin approver can edit it which leads to error on both splits after saving. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/77ffc470-52f7-4340-a136-cc48c4db783f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
